RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 97. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 26700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since May 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 2 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM BOARDER (CHI) took over leaving the half mile pole and set a clear pace, was urged away at the rail on the turn then steadily handled through the lane. FULLY CONNECTED chased toward the inside through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn then dueled through the stretch for second. CAIRO CALLING gave chase, raced in the three and four paths on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. JEFFERSON NATIVE showed brief early speed and gave chase past the half mile pole, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. POLITICAL DECISION saved ground. BALI'S SHADE raced well back and rounded the turn in the three and four paths. GAMING JACK saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Boarder (CHI)
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear pace from 1/2,urged away rail turn,steady handling lane

ENTRY.NAME: Fully Connected
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Eastham Richard

ENTRY.NAME: Jefferson Native
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early speed,chased past 1/2,off rail turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOXY SISTA broke in and made contact with Jumpin Jack Brass then raced with the early pace two deep, took the lead approaching the nine sixteenths pole and was rated from that point, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths, raced near the rail on the far turn and was kept alert to late stretch before being taken in hand. JUBASLILBALLERINA rated close off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail but had to settle for second. JUMPIN JACK BRASS bobbled and was bumped at the break then saved ground, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn but showed little further. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS came away awkwardly, was bumped then shuffled back and saved ground, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn. MEGEEZER settled in the three path on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. LAURA'S GRAND saved ground and showed little response. TAPTAP saved ground. HARLAN'S VALENTINE came away awkwardly and outward then raced with the early pace, gave chase leaving the nine sixteenths pole but faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 26700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Ol der, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 2 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALWAYS SOMETHING took over leaving the chute and set a clear pace through the backstretch, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and held well under steady handling. TRUE HEIRESS settled off the early pace then edged closer through the backstretch, started a bid at the rail into the turn, dug in from the eighth pole and just lasted for second. REIGN ON AND ON was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path, finished well and just missed second. SULTRY SALLY H gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and passed rivals. MY SISTER CLURRIE veered outward and made contact with Reign On And On leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path of the turn and passed rivals outside. CASTLE LIGHTS gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. WITNESS THE ENERGY gave chase toward the inside, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. SISTER'S DUTY chased outside, rounded the turn about the six path and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: True Heiress
ENTRY.COMMENT: off early pace,edged closer,bid rail 1/4,just lasted 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: My Sister Clurrie
ENTRY.OWNER: Strieter Marjorie and Deiter Kelly Lynn
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out,bumped break,chased,5p turn,passed rivals outside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 2 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,00 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ENTRY TIME gave chase and improved in the five path on the turn, then dueled from the head of the lane to take the nod in later yards. NOW HOOK'EM pressured the pace and reached even terms two deep midway on the turn, dueled gamely leaving the turn but yielded in late yards. JUBA BOUND gave distant early chase, raced near the rail on the turn then angled out into the lane, finished well and was gaining on the top two. LORD OF CORK chased, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. CASTLE TOY set a pressured pace leaving the chute, was met at even terms at the rail midway on the turn then weakened toward mid-stretch. FOREVER TAKES TIME chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. EL LUCERITO gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened widest in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Castle Toy
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met rail mid turn,weakened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Bound
ENTRY.COMMENT: distant early chase,rail turn,angled out1/8,finished well,gaining

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE DECEMBER 2, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNCAPTURED KING settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and improved in the five path of the far turn, left the turn widest and dug in to get up at the wire. LADDIE LIAM settled off the rail on the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in to even terms mid-stretch and held on to share. TOUGH TO TAME rounded the opening turn in the four path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close in the four path of the far turn and finished well between horses. FORT FORTITUDE raced hemmed at the rail on the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but raced on the heels of Charlie Potatoes through the far turn, took a brief slim lead near mid-stretch but was outfinished through later yards. HAPPY CHAMP rounded the first turn in the five path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn in the five path then flattened mid-stretch. CHARLIE POTATOES rated a slim lead leaving the three quarter pole, came under pressure toward the three eighths, contested the edge through the far turn but was met near mid-stretch and weakened the final sixteenth. ELEVATED FOREVER raced with the pace from the two and three paths, challenged nearing the three eighths pole but dropped back off the rail on the far turn and weakened the final sixteenth. TOP HAT TREASON settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path but showed little in the lane. ROCK FILE saved ground well off the pace, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Fortitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: hemmed rail 1st turn,chased 3/8,on heels far turn,outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Top Hat Treason
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Tough to Tame
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John and Longball Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Champ
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Laddie Liam
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,stalked 1/2,bid 3/8,3p far turn,held on to share

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 20700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Consid ered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIKE SEGAL veered in and made contact with Pyeong Chang leaving the gate then settled in the four path the first turn, bid passing the three eighths pole, improved in the three path of the far turn, lugged in through the upper stretch and came inside ADDY'S LADDY T N T to get up the final yards. The latter settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead toward the quarter, raced clear midway on the far turn but was caught in the final yards. PYEONG CHANG was bumped inward and into Night Boss leaving the gate, raced in the three path on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail but was shut off toward mid-stretch, altered course at that point and came back to finish well. DESPITE ODDS settled off the rail on the opening turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the five path of the far turn, left the turn outside and finished well. ROCKET DAWG rated a slim lead inside, was met toward the seven sixteenths pole and dueled from that point, gave up the lead at the rail approaching the quarter pole, dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened the final sixteenth. CHROME HEIR was pinched back at the start, rounded the first turn off the rail and could only improve his position. PRINCE OF FENTON tapered in and stalked into the first turn, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back approaching the quarter and weakened on the far turn. NIGHT BOSS was bumped leaving the gate and settled in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the four path of the far turn. AKINGISALWAYSKING showed little response. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of Like Segal for interference leaving the gate and through the upper stretch, lodged by the rider of Pyeong Chang, and as a result, disqualified the former for that which was previously mentioned.

ENTRY.NAME: Night Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Like Segal
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in,bumped break,4p,bid 3/8,3p far turn,lugged in,up late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 2 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCKY BLONDE stalked two deep on the first turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and dueled for the nod past the five sixteenths, drew clear midway on the far turn and held on under steady stretch encouragement. YOLO CHARLOTTE rated a slim lead inside, was met leaving the seven sixteenths pole and dueled from that point, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and was closing on the winner late. TIZ A COUNTRY GIRL was bumped leaving the gate and settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase passing the three eighths pole, had her heels clipped approaching the top of the stretch and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. XANTHE veered out and made contact with Tiz A Country Girl leaving the gate then saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, eased outward into the lane and finished evenly. HERETODAYGONMANANA raced hemmed in between horses on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn and checked to avoid a fallen rival toward the head of the lane. NO DENYING DENIS came away awkwardly and raced boxed at the rail the first turn, showed little response through the backstretch then checked to avoid a fallen rival toward the head of the lane. JUBA BABY broke a step slow and hit the gate at the break, rated close three wide on the first turn and gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path, clipped the heels of Tiz A Country Girl and fell approaching the eighth pole but got up and walked off. The Stewards reviewed the incident at the eighth pole before calling this race official.

ENTRY.NAME: Yolo Charlotte
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,met 7/16,dueled,dropped back mid turn,came again

ENTRY.NAME: Heretodaygonmanana
ENTRY.COMMENT: hemmed between 1st turn,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Baby
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 14400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OCEAN STORM was bumped leaving the gate and had a brief early lead inside then stalked, took over past the nine sixteenths pole, dueled the runner-up toward the five sixteenths and cleared that one past the quarter, dug in leaving the turn and held well under steady handling. MEETMARYSMAN tapered in and set the early pace off the rail, stalked from the nine sixteenths pole and dueled the winner nearing the five sixteenths, but dropped back passing the quarter, rounded the far turn off the rail, drifted into the lane then lugged in and flattened stride. CURB THAT TIGER saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, improved off the rail on the far turn but flattened the final sixteenth. CRUISE ON BY settled off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. FRANK THE BULL rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase into the backstretch but flattened in the four path of the far turn. COLONIAL ROAD raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn. JUBAY veered out leaving the gate and made contact with Ocean Storm, raced in the three and four paths of the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. BAND TOUR veered out leaving the gate, raced well back in the three and four paths on the opening turn and never factored. TOTHETRAINSTATION rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Tothetrainstation
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close 1st turn,chased 7/16,weakened rail into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Cruise On By
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Meetmarysman
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace off rail,dueled toward 5/16,lugged in,flattened
